SEARCH
Package org.fluentjdbc

Class DbContextSyncBuilder<T>

java.lang.Object
org.fluentjdbc.DbContextSyncBuilder<T>
public class DbContextSyncBuilder<T> extends Object
Combined operations for inserting, updating and deleting rows in a table based on a list of objects. Used to synchronize a database table with an external source such as an API or a CSV-file. DbContextSyncBuilder assumes it's acceptable to hold the full contents of both the table and the external source in memory during the synchronization, which scales well up to a few 100,000 rows.

Generate a DbContextSyncBuilder with DbContextTable.sync(List) with the target objects, then call unique(String, Function) and field(String, Function) to specify the relationship between the objects and the database table. Call cacheExisting() to load the table into memory and finally, call one or more of deleteExtras(), insertMissing() and updateDiffering() to execute the synchronization. Use getStatus() to get a summary of rows inserted, updated, deleted and unchanged.

Example:

     public EnumMap<DatabaseSaveResult.SaveStatus, Integer> syncProducts(List<Product> products) {
         return table.sync(products)
                 .unique("product_id", p -> p.getProductId().getValue())
                 .field("name", Product::getName)
                 .field("category", Product::getCategory)
                 .field("price_in_cents", Product::getPriceInCents)
                 .field("launched_at", Product::getLaunchedAt)
                 .cacheExisting()
                 .deleteExtras()
                 .insertMissing()
                 .updateDiffering()
                 .getStatus();
     }

    Compares the fields in two objects, most commonly an in-memory object and an object retrieved from the database with cacheExisting().
    DbContextSyncBuilder<T>
    cacheExisting()
    Loads all rows from the database.
    DbContextSyncBuilder<T>
    deleteExtras()
    Deletes from the database rows that are not included in the in-memory dataset, using DbContextBulkDeleteBuilder
    DbContextSyncBuilder<T>
    field(String field, Function<T,Object> valueFunction)
    Specifies how a column in the database relates to a value extracted from an in-memory object.
    EnumMap<DatabaseSaveResult.SaveStatus,Integer>
    getStatus()
    Returns the number of rows that were DatabaseSaveResult.SaveStatus.UPDATED, DatabaseSaveResult.SaveStatus.INSERTED, DatabaseSaveResult.SaveStatus.DELETED and DatabaseSaveResult.SaveStatus.UNCHANGED
    DbContextSyncBuilder<T>
    insertMissing()
    Inserts into the database rows that were included in the in-memory dataset, but that didn't have corresponding rows in the database, using DbContextBulkInsertBuilder
    DbContextSyncBuilder<T>
    unique(String field, Function<T,Object> valueFunction)
    Specifies that the field is a unique constraint and can be used to look up rows in the database based on objects in memory. valueFunction is used to extract the value from the in-memory object.
    DbContextSyncBuilder<T>
    updateDiffering()
    Updates in the database rows that were different in the in-memory dataset from the database, using DbContextBulkUpdateBuilder

    Used to compare rows a row in the database with a row in the in-memory dataset by looking them up with the key.

  • Constructor Details

    • DbContextSyncBuilder

      public DbContextSyncBuilder(DbContextTable table, List<T> theirObjects)

  • Method Details

    • unique

      @CheckReturnValue public DbContextSyncBuilder<T> unique(String field, Function<T,Object> valueFunction)
      Specifies that the field is a unique constraint and can be used to look up rows in the database based on objects in memory. valueFunction is used to extract the value from the in-memory object. If unique is called several times, DbContextSyncBuilder assumes a composite unique key. All unique fields must have a correct equals and hashCode

    • field

      @CheckReturnValue public DbContextSyncBuilder<T> field(String field, Function<T,Object> valueFunction)
      Specifies how a column in the database relates to a value extracted from an in-memory object. Call this method for each non-unique field in the database that should be included in the synchronization

    • cacheExisting

      public DbContextSyncBuilder<T> cacheExisting()
      Loads all rows from the database. If called again, this method does nothing

    • deleteExtras

      public DbContextSyncBuilder<T> deleteExtras()
      Deletes from the database rows that are not included in the in-memory dataset, using DbContextBulkDeleteBuilder

    • insertMissing

      public DbContextSyncBuilder<T> insertMissing()
      Inserts into the database rows that were included in the in-memory dataset, but that didn't have corresponding rows in the database, using DbContextBulkInsertBuilder

    • updateDiffering

      public DbContextSyncBuilder<T> updateDiffering()
      Updates in the database rows that were different in the in-memory dataset from the database, using DbContextBulkUpdateBuilder

    • valuesEqual

      @CheckReturnValue protected boolean valuesEqual(List<Object> key)
      Used to compare rows a row in the database with a row in the in-memory dataset by looking them up with the key. The objects in the key must match the fields specified with unique(String, Function)

    • areEqualLists

      @CheckReturnValue protected boolean areEqualLists(List<?> a, List<?> b)
      Compares the fields in two objects, most commonly an in-memory object and an object retrieved from the database with cacheExisting(). Override this for example if you have columns that should not be included in the comparison

    • areEqual

      @CheckReturnValue protected boolean areEqual(Object o, Object o1)
      Compares a single field for equality. Override this if you have data types that should have special comparison rules

    • getStatus

      @CheckReturnValue public EnumMap<DatabaseSaveResult.SaveStatus,Integer> getStatus()
      Returns the number of rows that were DatabaseSaveResult.SaveStatus.UPDATED, DatabaseSaveResult.SaveStatus.INSERTED, DatabaseSaveResult.SaveStatus.DELETED and DatabaseSaveResult.SaveStatus.UNCHANGED
